snippet: The courts should reject a perverse new challenge to the law’s health insurance subsidies.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Brookings fellow Henry J Aaron, Prof David M Cutler and Citigroup vice chairman Peter R Orszag decries efforts by opponents of Affordable Care Act to convince courts that law requires subsidies to be paid only in states with online exchanges; warns that such interpretation of law would invalidate it, causing widespread chaos; urges courts to reject such obvious and flawed attempts to undermine law.

byline.original: By HENRY J. AARON, DAVID M. CUTLER and PETER ORSZAG

lead_paragraph: The courts should reject a perverse new challenge to the law’s health insurance subsidies.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
